citations.narrative:
A 13-year-old female rhesus macaque sustained a hindlimb fracture during a routine cage transfer on 4/23/2023. During
the transfer, the nonhuman primate (NHP) escaped from her cage into the room. The animal went behind some of the
cages and then started jumping on them, which led to attempted fighting between her and the other NHPs inside the
cages. It is unclear exactly how the injuries occurred, but the facility staff observed blood on the macaque's leg and
sudden onset of left hindlimb lameness. It is suspected that the animal's leg slipped between the bars of one of the cages
and became caught while leaping from cage to cage. Upon examination and fluoroscopic imaging, the NHP was
diagnosed with fractures to her left tibia and fibula. In addition, four puncture wounds were noted on the skin overlying the
fracture site, which were presumed to be due to fracture segments piercing the skin. The attending veterinarian provided
appropriate treatment for the animal, and the fracture is healing well.
Handling of animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible so as not to cause physical harm.
The research facility implemented corrective actions to include refinements to the animal transfer process, refresher
training for staff, and equipment modifications. Corrected prior to the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
A 13-year-old female rhesus macaque sustained a hindlimb fracture during a routine cage transfer on 4/23/2023.  During 
the transfer, the nonhuman primate (NHP) escaped from her cage into the room.  The animal went behind some of the 
cages and then started jumping on them, which led to attempted fighting between her and the other NHPs inside the 
cages.  It is unclear exactly how the injuries occurred, but the facility staff observed blood on the macaque's leg and 
sudden onset of left hindlimb lameness.  It is suspected that the animal's leg slipped between the bars of one of the cages 
and became caught while leaping from cage to cage.  Upon examination and fluoroscopic imaging, the NHP was 
diagnosed with fractures to her left tibia and fibula.  In addition, four puncture wounds were noted on the skin overlying the 
fracture site, which were presumed to be due to fracture segments piercing the skin.  The attending veterinarian provided 
appropriate treatment for the animal, and the fracture is healing well. 
 
Handling of animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible so as not to cause physical harm. 
 
The research facility implemented corrective actions to include refinements to the animal transfer process, refresher 
training for staff, and equipment modifications.   Corrected prior to the inspection.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
